definition: lit. the exertion of lifting one's hand (idiom)/fig. a very slight effort
to lift/to hold up/to cite/to enumerate/to act/to raise/to choose/to elect/act/move/deed
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)

sentences.english: To reform a man is a tedious and uncertain labour; hanging the sure work of a minute.
sentences.chinese: 改造人是冗長而無把握的工作，絞刑則是舉手之勞。

sentences.english: Be sure they don’t lift a finger for their special day.
sentences.chinese: 確保他們不舉手之勞用於特殊的一天。

sentences.english: We can help to protect Taiwan's nature treasures by just lifting a finger.
sentences.chinese: 我們只要舉手之勞，就可以保護臺灣的自然資產。

sentences.english: It does with its own highly-trained staff, so you don't have to lift a finger.
sentences.chinese: 它擁有高度訓練的職員，所以你不必耗費舉手之勞。

sentences.english: It would be so little to You, God, such a little, little thing.
sentences.chinese: 上帝，對你來說這簡直就是小菜一碟，舉手之勞。

sentences.english: But since it promises easy cash, people believe it.
sentences.chinese: 可是因爲只要舉手之勞即可賺錢，以人們寧可信其有。

sentences.english: I was so embarrassed, lift a finger, what is there against it?
sentences.chinese: 我很尷尬，舉手之勞，何樂而不爲呢？

definition: to wish for the whole world to be in chaos (idiom)
pinyin: wei2 kong3 tian1 xia4 bu4 luan4

debt of gratitude
to have boundless prospects

to exaggerate

to submit to the will of heaven/to resign oneself to fate/to trust to luck
true sentiments are seen in hard times (idiom)/you see who your true friends are when you go through tough times together/you see who your true friends are when you are in difficulties
to extort under false pretenses/to blackmail/to bluff/to defraud

to know what's going on
lit. to work like an ox, to work like a horse; fig. to work extremely hard
to stay calm/to keep one's composure
